Sentencas: Doped ceria barrier layers have extensively been used between Fe and/or Co containing cathode materials and conventional yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolytes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs) to improve performance and prevent unwanted chemical reactions between them.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: However, the chemical compatibility between the YSZ and doped ceria depends strongly on the sintering temperature and atmosphere.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: This study focuses on the influence of temperature and sintering atmosphere in the crystal structure.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: microstructure and conductivity of bulk mixtures of YSZ and Sm0.2Ce0.8O1.9 (SDC).
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: Polycrystalline mixtures of YSZ-SDC (50% weight) were sintered between 950 and 1350 degrees C in air, Ar and hydrogen containing reducing atmospheres.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: X-ray powder diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), energy dispersive X-ray analysis (EDX) and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) were used to analyse the chemical interactions between SDC and YSZ under different processing conditions.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: Overall, diffusion between SDC and YSZ is observed for all cases but the solid solution formed depends upon the temperature and the sintering atmosphere.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: The additional formation of (Ce.Sm)(2)Zr2O7 pyrochlore is observed when sintering under reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: SEM and EDX analysis reveal microstructure variations with higher homogeneity for the samples sintered in argon or hydrogen.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications

Sentencas: The sintering behaviour and the total conductivity properties are also dependent on sintering atmospheres, showing that inert conditions may yield the best performing YSZ-SDC system for SOFC applications.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility between YSZ and SDC sintered at different atmospheres for SOFC applications
